div.p: Primary School and Junior School was happy dancing about, I had a really good time; Senior School started off OK Years 7 and 8,
in Year 9 I had quite a bad time, I was being bullied, I went to an all girls school, and one day I went in and nobody was talking to me
and that lasted for about 4 or 5 months. You know it really damaged my self-esteem and my self-worth, I was isolated where I was quite a happy child
and got on with everybody and, you know, was always there and out and about so to staying at home really, quite scared to and put out
that I was really scared to go to school so yeah...
There was a lady and basically she did mentoring and I used to go to her and she was very encouraging, her name is Dee actually
I didn’t learn that until about 5 years ago because obviously you call her Mrs... I think the mentor that I spoke about earlier is the only one
that thought something’s not quite right here but I went through Primary to Senior School with nobody actually picking it up
it’s not until I went to College and obviously you’ve got to sit a test and then they said you’re slightly dyslexic which was good, I was happy about that
because then I didn’t feel stupid, and like something obviously wasn’t right so...
